questions.question: Put a coat .................................. before going out.
questions.description: To put a coat on is to wear it.

questions.question: The business was losing money, so they closed it ............................
I am going to the airport to see .................................... my friend.
questions.description: To see off is to go to the railway station or airport to say goodbye to someone who is leaving.

questions.question: It is always a good idea to take .................................. travel insurance.
questions.description: To take out travel insurance is to purchase it.

questions.question: The doctor advised him to give ................................. smoking.
questions.description: To give up smoking is to quit smoking.

questions.question: I make it a point to catch .................................. my sleep when I am on holiday.
questions.description: To catch up on sleep is to sleep for an extra hour or two.

questions.question: Because of your irresponsible act, we got caught ................................ in a great deal of trouble.
questions.description: To get caught up in trouble is to land yourself in trouble.

questions.question: This achievement calls ................................ a celebration.
questions.description: If something calls for something, it necessitates it.

questions.question: Her performance was amazing. I was blown .................................... by it.
questions.description: When you are blown away by something, you find it to be absolutely brilliant.

questions.question: She has come ...................................... a lot of criticism over the manner in which she handled the situation.
questions.description: to come in for criticism is to receive it.

questions.question: I came ....................................... these old photographs while I was clearing up the closets.
questions.description: To come across something is to find it by chance.

questions.question: The company chalked ..................................... record profits last year.
questions.description: To chalk up profits is to earn profits.
